intro: Dinteracanthus marlothii, commonly known as the Marloth's thornveld, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in shrubland and rocky areas. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
